meanings.definition: A person or thing that precipitates something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a great precipitator of discussions in class.
meanings.sent2: The rain cloud acted as a natural precipitator of water droplets.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was a cute little precipitator of chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a precipitator of joy in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock served as a reliable precipitator of waking up early.

meanings.definition: A device used to remove particulates from a gas stream.
meanings.sent1: The air purifier in the room was an effective precipitator of dust particles.
meanings.sent2: The electrostatic precipitator helped clean the emissions from the factory.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum acted as a diligent little precipitator of dirt on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The wind was a natural precipitator, clearing the smoke from the area.
meanings.sent5: The filter in the coffee machine was a crucial precipitator of coffee grounds from the brew.
